result.execSummary:
The defendant Joe Louis Singleterry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 8/26/22 by 6:00 p.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:02 PM Defendant Joe Louis Singleterry in court.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for Joe Louis Singleterry.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today to OWI4th as noted in Amended Information; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Def. pleads NC to OWI4th; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of OWI4th; State heard. .119 bac; Atty. Snow heard; discussion on length between convictions/jail report in date; State moves to strike wording in Amended Information re: offense w/in 5 years (last offense was 15 years); Court so orders; Court imposes sentence; report to P&P by 4pm today

**W/H - 36 mo. PO
- 180 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 8/26/22
- $600 F+C = $1,589 w/in 60 days
- $250 DNA surcharge/sample
- $26 Blood draw fee
- AODA & FT
- absolute sobriety, no bars, etc.
* 30 mo. Rev. & IID

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 021692,
Payable Number: 238756,
Receipt Number: 22R 001851,
Amount: $20.00
Acknowledgement by Person Posting Bail/Deposit

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall stay off the premises of bowling alleys.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.

12:52 PM Defendant Joe Louis Singleterry in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley (eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1,000 Cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents and bowling alleys.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
